description: For a specified resource ID, this API operation returns a list of compliance statuses for different resource types. Currently, you can only specify one resource ID per call. List results depend on the criteria specified in the filter.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more compliance filters. Use a filter to return a more specific list of results. (dict) --- One or more filters. Key (string) --- The name of the filter. Values (list) --- The value for which to search. (string) --- Type (string) --- The type of comparison that should be performed for the value: Equal, NotEqual, BeginWith, LessThan, or GreaterThan.

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: The value for which to search.

nested_params.name: Type
nested_params.description: The type of comparison that should be performed for the value: Equal, NotEqual, BeginWith, LessThan, or GreaterThan.

parameters.name: ResourceIds
parameters.description: The ID for the resources from which to get compliance information. Currently, you can only specify one resource ID. (string) ---

parameters.name: ResourceTypes
parameters.description: The type of resource from which to get compliance information. Currently, the only supported resource type is ManagedInstance. (string) ---

nested_items.name: ComplianceItems
nested_items.description: A list of compliance information for the specified resource ID.

nested_items.name: ComplianceType
nested_items.description: The compliance type. For example, Association (for a State Manager association), Patch, or Custom: string are all valid compliance types.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: The type of resource. ManagedInstance is currently the only supported resource type.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: An ID for the resource. For a managed node, this is the node ID.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: An ID for the compliance item. For example, if the compliance item is a Windows patch, the ID could be the number of the KB article; for example: KB4010320.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: A title for the compliance item. For example, if the compliance item is a Windows patch, the title could be the title of the KB article for the patch; for example: Security Update for Active Directory Federation Services.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the compliance item. An item is either COMPLIANT, NON_COMPLIANT, or an empty string (for Windows patches that aren't applicable).

nested_items.name: Severity
nested_items.description: The severity of the compliance status. Severity can be one of the following: Critical, High, Medium, Low, Informational, Unspecified.

nested_items.name: ExecutionSummary
nested_items.description: A summary for the compliance item. The summary includes an execution ID, the execution type (for example, command), and the execution time.

nested_items.name: ExecutionTime
nested_items.description: The time the execution ran as a datetime object that is saved in the following format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'

nested_items.name: ExecutionId
nested_items.description: An ID created by the system when PutComplianceItems was called. For example, CommandID is a valid execution ID. You can use this ID in subsequent calls.

nested_items.name: ExecutionType
nested_items.description: The type of execution. For example, Command is a valid execution type.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token for the next set of items to return. Use this token to get the next set of results.
